content: Many thanks to the reviewers and approvers who helped me for this new contribution

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: New kind of board game with 3 players ! 
Rules are simple ! 
Good opportunities to investigate new algorithms ! 
Thank you for this contribution

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is an original 3 player game with enough complexity to make it interesting. It also has potential to be a training ground for search algorithms. It is a 3 player game with a very simple simulation so it can be used to try 3 player mcts algorithms. Nice addition.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple but complex enough, referee not crashing, graphics ok.
Very fun challange! Nice
Boss upgraded to be somewhat better than pure random. Nothing too terrific though ...

A new set of changes:

* For each player, the inputs now gives the player state and the last valid move. Read the updated statements for full explanation. Of course, this breaks existing bots. Required changes are simple.
* When computing initial knight positions, borders are excluded. This insures that each player has at least 4 valid moves to start with.
* A few UI changes

The rules remain the same.

3 player madknights seems cool. It should probably have a repeated random generation until a viable starting position is reached. I suggest every horsey should have at least 3 possible destinations. Probably you won't need to retry the random generation more than once and most of the time not at all.
The highlights between moves should have players' color - not all blue.
The game is now a 3 players game. This breaks all bots of course. Enjoy ...

Hello darkhorse64, 
Thanks for this new board game proposal !
I have a question about the game balance : are you sure that the game is not always a "white" win ?
For the moment in the test arena, the "thinking" bots (yours, MSmits one & mine) seems to have a huge advantage to start with white.

Many thanks for the review.  I implemented all of your recommended changes and suggestions. Regarding the  "useful for stub code generation" part, it is more relevant to game design than anything else and I chose to remove it. This "random" thing is a nice trick to get a working bot without doing anything. It is also very useful in testing phase because it provides the dreaded "monkey" tester. Of course, if all goes well, I will probably write a more challenging bot.

The Game
* Please change "a implementation" to "an implementation".

Rules
* Suggest to change "a chess knight" to "a knight".

* Please change "The initial position of the pieces is" to "The initial positions of the pieces are".

* Please change "are outside" to "is outside"

Output section
* Missing quotation mark after "e3". Actually, all the quotation marks may be removed around the texts formatted as constants.

* Suggest to change "instead of a move" to "instead of specific coordinates".

* Suggest to mention that one of the legal moves is chosen if possible for a random move.

* I don't understand the "useful for stub code generation" part (e.g. you can always change "random" to "e3"). Maybe mention that it is the logic used by the default boss instead?

Thanks.
I made substantial changes to the statement. It would be nice if you could please review the English.

As it is today, the game is a win for P2 in all current starting positions. P2 wins by mirroring P1 moves. All other moves leads to a win by P1 as you found out. MSmits is running a meta analysis to find out if there are more balanced starting positions. Preliminary results are not good ...
Yeah, let's make the game with all sorts of colors. Christmas is coming ;-)

I'll look into it. Maybe something as simple as excluding the corners would do it. In that case, under the most unfavoravorable circumstances, a knight would have at least 2 liberties. When excluding all borders, this number would jump to 4. That looks like a fairly well balanced start.
Sure sounds good to me.
Since it's only a debug feature, I opted for a neutral color for all.

Thanks for the informations. 
3 players is perhaps another game ?
Ah, ah, interesting suggestion

Thank you for letting me know! üëçüèª

Just one comment on the English:
Rules
* Please change "insure" to "ensure".

Other than that, I would suggest in "Input for one game turn" to change "empty" to "open" (because a blocked cell is also empty).

Thanks again. üôÇ
Statement updated. Many thanks !

Oh, by the way, I have access to the statement for Level 1 only. I don't know how I can see the statements for higher levels here. If you'd like me to check the statements for higher levels as well, you may send those to me by PM on the forum or on Discord. Or more conveniently, if there's a way to directly access here, please let me know. Thanks.
There is only one league in the game and I see no level indication. I am puzzled
Oh sorry, I think I misunderstood what's said on Discord. Please ignore it üòõ
